title: Institute Strategy
mainText: The main strategic objective of the Institute of Ferrous Metallurgy is to conduct fundamental and applied scientific research aimed at developing and practically implementing the latest energy- and resource-saving technologies that meet international standards and define the development of Ukrainian metallurgy during the period of martial law and post-war recovery. Particular attention is paid to developments aimed at strengthening the country's defense capabilities.
strategicDirections: Decarbonization and gradual transition to low-carbon technologies in blast furnace production;
Development of an energy-efficient technology for steel smelting in oxygen converters with an increased share of scrap metal, which involves a two-stage process;
Development of new and improvement of existing technologies for the production of metal rolled products for the urgent needs and post-war recovery of Ukraine;

Improving the service properties of heavy plate used for manufacturing critical metal products, including for the defense industry, by improving steel smelting and deoxidation technology, refining its chemical composition, and developing effective heat treatment regimes;
Expansion of fundamental research in the field of additive technologies to enhance Ukraine's defense capabilities;
Development of new technologies for complex heat, deformation-thermal, and cryogenic treatment.
